info.title: Server APIs (Java + MongoDB)
info.description:
## Hi. I am Lim Leong Kee.

I have developed the entire set of server-side APIs using **Java**, with **MongoDB** as the underlying database. These APIs are fully documented and available for exploration and interaction via this page.

Once you have registered and logged in to your account, you will be able to:

  - ðŸŽ® Play games: 1. Guess Number | 2. Arrange Numbers | 3. Rock Paper Scissors (Practice and Challenge modes)

  - ðŸ‘¤ View your game profile or another user's game profile

  - ðŸ† Check the leaderboard

> All API endpoints are interactive and can be tested directly using the **"Try it out"** button located to the right of each endpoint on this page!

Additionally, I customized this Swagger UI by integrating my own **HTML** and **JavaScript** files to provide the following features:

  1. ðŸ” **Automatic JWT Handling:** Automatically captures the JWT token upon successful login and injects it into all requests targeting protected endpoints.

  2. ðŸšª **Logout Behavior:** Clears the JWT token upon logout to prevent access to protected endpoints until the user logs in again.

  3. ðŸ§© **Custom Operation Sorting:** API operations are sorted using a custom logic for a cleaner, more intuitive navigation experience.

I would sincerely appreciate any feedback, suggestions, or improvements you might have. Thank you for taking the time to review my work.

post.summary: Practise the Rock Paper Scissors game for fun.
post.description:
Practise the Rock Paper Scissors game for fun. No points to earn. The number of attempts will not increase with each play.

Select your choice â€” Rock, Paper or Scissors â€” from the drop-down list in the `yourChoice` field. Rock beats Scissors. Scissors beats Paper. Paper beats Rock.

Then, press the **Execute** button and see the result.

post.summary: Play the Rock Paper Scissors game with another user. Use this endpoint to start a new round or continue the current round to play the game.
post.description:
**Important:** You must have at least 1 point to play this game. You can play other games to earn points or claim bonus points if you have not claimed them yet.

1. Choose an opponent by entering the opponent's username in the `opponentUsername` field.

2. Select your choice â€” Rock, Paper or Scissors â€” from the drop-down list in the `yourChoice` field.
> Rock beats Scissors.
> Scissors beats Paper.
> Paper beats Rock.

3. Enter how many points that you want to stake in the `pointsToStake` field. If you win, you will receive the staked points from the opponent. If you lose, you will transfer the staked points to the opponent.

4. Press the **Execute** button and see the result.

parameters.name: opponentUsername
parameters.description: The username of the opponent that you choose to challenge

parameters.name: pointsToStake
parameters.description: The number of points that you want to stake

401.description: Unauthorized â€” invalid or missing token

post.summary: Guess a number from 1 to 100 in this game. Use this endpoint to start a new round or continue the current round to play
post.description:
Guess and enter a number **from 1 to 100** in the `yourGuessedNumber` field. Then, press the **Execute** button and see the result.

### In each round, there are 3 hidden numbers.
- **Basic Number**: Gives a hint after each wrong guess. If correctly guessed, awards +1 point and complete the round.
- **Secret Number**: No hints provided. If correctly guessed, awards +3 points and complete the round.
- **Trap Number**: No hints provided. If unfortunately guessed, lose 1 point but the round continues.

> Your goal is to guess either the Basic Number or Secret Number to complete the round â€” but beware of the Trap Number!

400.description: Invalid input â€” number must be between 1 and 100

401.description: Unauthorized â€” invalid or missing token

403.description: Forbidden â€” guessing is not allowed at this time

post.summary: Claim bonus points once every 3 hours.
post.description:
You can claim +1 bonus point every 3 hours. There is a 50% chance to receive +2 points instead!

Once claimed, the bonus point(s) will be added to your current score.

After claiming, you must wait for 3 hours before you are eligible to claim the next bonus points.

401.description: Unauthorized â€” invalid or missing token

425.description: Too Early â€” Bonus points already claimed

post.summary: Guess the sequence of 5 numbers in this game. Use this endpoint to start a new round or continue the current round to play.
post.description:
Guess and enter the sequence of the 5 numbers (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) in the `yourGuessedNumber` field. The sequence can be any arrangement of these numbers (For example: 4, 3, 5, 1, 2). Then, press the **Execute** button and see the result.

### Hints you will receive after each wrong guess:
- **[X]**: Number X is at the correct position.
- **-X-**: Number X is at the wrong position.
- **?X?**: Number X is invalid. Valid numbers are only 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
- **#X#**: Number X is duplicated.

> Your goal is to enter the 5 numbers in the sequence defined by the game for the current round to complete the round. Completing a round awards you +2 points.

parameters.name: yourArrangedNumbers
parameters.description: Guess the sequence of the 5 numbers defined by the game for the current round

401.description: Unauthorized â€” invalid or missing token

400.description: Invalid input â€” must be exactly 5 numbers between 1 and 5

post.summary: Registers for a new user account.
post.description:
Registers for a new user account.

### Request body must include:
- `username` (unique)
- `password`

> Once registered successfully, you can log in using the `/api/auth/login` endpoint to receive a JWT token.

post.description: Log out from the user account that you are currently logged in to.

401.description: Unauthorized â€” invalid or missing token

post.summary: Log in to an existing user account.
post.description:
Authenticates a user with username and password.

On success, returns a JWT access token in the `token` field.

**How to use the token in Swagger UI:**

1. Copy the `token` from the response.

2. Click the **Authorize** button (top right in Swagger UI).

3. Paste the token into the `value` input field.

4. Click **Authorize** â€” now your requests will include the token.
